name: Forward Roll
description: The forward roll is a foundational tumbling skill where the athlete initiates a controlled roll from a standing position, tucking into a rounded shape and moving head-over-heels along the spine. This skill develops body awareness, coordination, and introduces athletes to safe inversion techniques.
shapeTip: Begin by standing with feet shoulder-width apart. Tuck the chin tightly to the chest to protect the neck. Round the back and bend the knees deeply, placing hands on the floor. Push evenly with the legs to roll over the shoulders—not the head—keeping a tight tuck and arms wrapped around the shins throughout the roll.

movements.name: Neck Tuck Prep
movements.instructions: Stand tall and practice tucking the chin tightly to the chest while rounding the shoulders forward.

movements.name: Rock and Roll
movements.instructions: Sit in a tuck shape and gently rock back and forth along the spine, keeping the chin tucked and knees hugged.

movements.name: Wall Rolls
movements.instructions: Use a padded incline or wall mat to roll down safely, reinforcing head and shoulder placement.

movements.name: Forward Roll Attempts
movements.instructions: From standing or squat, perform a controlled forward roll focusing on tight shape and smooth motion.

movements.name: Rest
movements.instructions: Relax and stretch the neck and back. Prepare for another round.

tutorials.title: How to Do a Forward Roll in Gymnastics
How to Forward Roll | Gymnastics Tutorial

name: Backward Roll
description: The backward roll is a foundational inversion skill that teaches athletes how to safely roll backward over their shoulders while maintaining body control and awareness. This movement begins from a squat or standing position and uses momentum, a strong tuck, and a push from the hands to guide the body through a smooth, continuous roll.
shapeTip: Start in a squat position with knees bent and chin tucked toward the chest. As you sit back, keep your arms bent and close to your ears, palms    facing the ceiling. Tuck tightly, roll over the back of the shoulders (not the neck), and push firmly through the hands when they make contact with the floor to complete the motion and return to standing.

movements.name: Tuck Rock Backs
movements.instructions: Sit in a tight tuck and rock back onto your shoulders, keeping your chin tucked and hands by your ears.

movements.name: Bridge Push Drills
movements.instructions: Practice pushing through your hands from a bridge position to simulate the arm action in a backward roll.

movements.name: Incline Backward Rolls
movements.instructions: Perform backward rolls down a wedge mat or incline to reinforce motion and confidence.

movements.name: Backward Roll Attempts
movements.instructions: Start in a squat and perform full backward rolls, focusing on a tight tuck and pushing through the arms to finish standing.

movements.name: Rest
movements.instructions: Breathe deeply and stretch your shoulders and neck to prepare for the next set.

tutorials.title: How to do a backward roll
Head Over Heels Gymnastics Tutorials, Learn how to do a Backwards Roll

name: Handstand
description: The handstand is a fundamental inversion that challenges an athlete’s balance, strength, and alignment. It involves supporting the entire body vertically on the hands with legs extended overhead. This skill builds core strength, shoulder stability, and spatial awareness, making it essential for advanced tumbling and stunting.
shapeTip: Begin in a lunge, kick up with control. Keep arms locked, shoulders shrugged to ears, and core tight. Engage the legs together in a straight line, reaching toes toward the ceiling and spotting between the hands for balance.

movements.name: Wall Walks
movements.instructions: Start in a push-up position and walk your feet up a wall while walking hands closer to the wall. Maintain a tight core and straight body line.

movements.name: Shoulder Shrugs
movements.instructions: In a handstand against the wall, shrug shoulders up and down to build shoulder stability and awareness.

movements.name: Body Tension Holds
movements.instructions: Lay on your back in a hollow hold or on your stomach in a superman to reinforce core engagement for handstands.

movements.name: Wall Handstand Hold
movements.instructions: Kick into a handstand against a wall and hold for time, focusing on tight legs, pointed toes, and straight alignment.

movements.name: Rest
movements.instructions: Relax and shake out your arms and shoulders. Breathe deeply and prepare for the next set.

tutorials.title: Tumbling Drills: Handstands
HANDSTAND SHAPING // Tumbling Drills

name: Cartwheel
description: The cartwheel is a sideways traveling skill that teaches body rotation and spatial orientation. It introduces lateral movement and transitions between vertical and horizontal body shapes, laying the groundwork for more advanced acro skills.
shapeTip: Start in a wide lunge with arms by ears. Reach toward the floor, placing hands one at a time while kicking legs over in a wide arc. Keep legs straight, toes pointed, and finish facing the opposite direction in a controlled lunge.

movements.name: Lunge to T
movements.instructions: Start in a deep lunge, then shift forward into a T-position with arms by ears and back leg lifted to prepare body alignment.

movements.name: Side Hand Placements
movements.instructions: Practice reaching sideways to place hands one at a time on the floor, mimicking the start of a cartwheel.

movements.name: Leg Kicks Over Block
movements.instructions: Kick one leg at a time over a soft block or mat to simulate the motion of a cartwheel with correct shape and control.

movements.name: Cartwheel Attempts
movements.instructions: Perform full cartwheels from a lunge, focusing on straight legs, wide straddle, and finishing in the opposite lunge.

movements.name: Rest
movements.instructions: Shake out arms and legs. Breathe and recover before continuing.

tutorials.title: How to teach a cartwheel to a young child
How to Improve Your Cartwheels

name: Roundoff
description: The roundoff is a powerful tumbling transition that resembles a cartwheel but finishes with the feet together and a backward momentum. It’s commonly used to generate speed and lift for connected skills like back handsprings and tucks.
shapeTip: Start like a cartwheel but snap the legs together at the end to land with both feet, arms swinging overhead. Focus on a strong rebound and a quick transition from hands to feet.

movements.name: Cartwheel Snap-Downs
movements.instructions: Perform cartwheels focusing on snapping the legs together at the end to land feet simultaneously and generate power.

movements.name: Handstand Snap Downs
movements.instructions: Kick up into a handstand and practice snapping the feet down quickly together to build rebound mechanics.

movements.name: Panel Mat Roundoffs
movements.instructions: Use a panel mat or line to emphasize straight hand and foot placement and correct body angle during roundoff.

movements.name: Roundoff Attempts
movements.instructions: Perform full roundoffs with focus on straight arms, powerful leg snap, and finishing in a controlled rebound.

movements.name: Rest
movements.instructions: Shake out arms and legs. Focus on breathing and reset before continuing.

tutorials.title: 11 Crazy Effective Round Off Drills To Improve Tumbling (Cheer & Gymnastics)
How to do a Gymnastics Roundoff

name: Front Walkover
description: A graceful skill where the athlete passes through a handstand from a forward lunge, landing one foot at a time. It emphasizes flexibility, control, and a smooth flow of movement through inversion.
shapeTip: Begin in a lunge and kick into a handstand, arching through the back. Push off the hands as one leg reaches the ground first, followed by the second leg, landing softly in a split stance.

movements.name: Bridge Kickovers
movements.instructions: Start in a bridge and practice kicking over one leg at a time to build flexibility and leg drive.

movements.name: Lunge to Handstand Drill
movements.instructions: From a lunge, kick into a handstand position with control and alignment, then return to lunge.

movements.name: Wall Leg Isolation
movements.instructions: Use a wall to isolate leg lift, focusing on split position and control during the descent.

movements.name: Front Walkover Attempts
movements.instructions: Perform front walkovers with emphasis on a smooth kick, strong arms, and soft, split-legged landings.

movements.name: Rest
movements.instructions: Stretch wrists, shoulders, and back. Breathe and prepare for the next round.

tutorials.title: How to do a Front Walkover (Tutorial Hack) - Forward Walkover
Front walkover drills...
FRONT WALKOVER // Tumbling Drills

name: Back Walkover
description: This skill starts from a standing position and involves a backward rotation through a handstand, landing one foot at a time. It builds confidence in backward movement, back flexibility, and shoulder mobility.
shapeTip: Reach back into a bridge with arms straight and legs split. Push off the hands and lead with the dominant leg to stand up gracefully, keeping the movement fluid and controlled.

movements.name: Bridge Holds
movements.instructions: Hold a strong bridge with straight arms and legs. Focus on shoulder mobility and pushing chest over hands.

movements.name: Leg Lifts from Bridge
movements.instructions: From a bridge, lift one leg at a time to build strength and control needed for walkover transitions.

movements.name: Wall Kickovers
movements.instructions: Use a wall or incline to assist in kicking over one leg at a time from a bridge position.

movements.name: Back Walkover Attempts
movements.instructions: Start standing, reach into a bridge, and kick over with one leg, finishing in a split or lunge.

movements.name: Rest
movements.instructions: Relax and stretch out shoulders, wrists, and back. Breathe before the next set.

tutorials.title: Back bend and back walkover drills
Back Walkover Drills

name: Standing Back Handspring
description: A fast, dynamic skill involving a backward jump into a handstand position followed by a quick snap down to the feet. It demands timing, power, and upper body strength.
shapeTip: Sit back like you’re sitting in a chair, arms tight by ears. Jump backward with speed and commit fully. Keep the body tight and snap the legs down fast to land on the feet.

movements.name: Sit and Jump Drills
movements.instructions: Practice sitting into a low squat and exploding upward with arms tight by ears to simulate the takeoff.

movements.name: Snap-Down Handstand
movements.instructions: Kick to handstand and snap down with control, landing feet together to build speed and body alignment.

movements.name: Wrist Rockers
movements.instructions: Rock gently from palm to fingers in a push-up position to prepare wrists for backward weight transfer.

movements.name: Back Handspring Attempts
movements.instructions: Perform standing back handsprings with focus on arm drive, tight body shape, and quick snap-down to feet.

movements.name: Rest
movements.instructions: Shake out arms and shoulders. Stretch wrists and breathe before continuing.

tutorials.title: 5 DRILLS TO FIX YOUR BACK HANDSPRING!
Back Handsprings Tips and Drills featuring Coach Mary Lee Tracy

name: Roundoff Back Handspring
description: A connected pass combining the explosive power of a roundoff with the dynamic motion of a back handspring. It's a foundation for advanced tumbling series.
shapeTip: Execute a strong roundoff with a deep snap-down and fast arm swing. Transition immediately into a back handspring, keeping the chest open and arms by the ears.

movements.name: Roundoff Snap-Down Rebound
movements.instructions: Perform roundoffs focusing on strong snap-downs and high, tight rebounds to prep for connection.

movements.name: Handstand Snap Drills
movements.instructions: Kick to a handstand, then snap down quickly to reinforce fast transitions and body control.

movements.name: Back Handspring Arm Swings
movements.instructions: Practice deep sit positions and aggressive arm swings backward to simulate the takeoff from rebound.

movements.name: Roundoff Back Handspring Attempts
movements.instructions: Connect a roundoff into a back handspring with tight form, strong arm drive, and solid landing mechanics.

movements.name: Rest
movements.instructions: Shake out your wrists and shoulders. Take deep breaths and prepare for the next round.

tutorials.title: Roundoff Progression and Drills - Gymnastics Tumbling Tutorial featuring Coach Mary Lee Tracy
ROUND OFF BACK HANDSPRINGS // Tumbling Drills
Tips And Drills To Help You With Your Round Off Back handsprings!
How To Round Off Back Handspring | Tumbling Tutorial

name: Standing Back Tuck
description: A standing backflip performed without the use of hands, requiring explosive power and precise timing. It develops air awareness and body control at higher speeds.
shapeTip: Jump straight up, not back. Pull the knees to the chest quickly and keep hands wrapped around the shins. Spot the landing early and absorb the impact through the legs.

movements.name: Jump Drills
movements.instructions: Explode straight up off the ground with arms tight by your ears.

movements.name: Tuck Shape Holds
movements.instructions: Hold a tuck shape on your back or in a candlestick.

movements.name: Standing Back Jumps
movements.instructions: Practice jumping and tucking with arm swing.

movements.name: Rest
movements.instructions: Breathe and shake out your legs.

movements.name: Back Tuck Attempts
movements.instructions: Perform clean, controlled back tucks.

tutorials.title: Back tuck drills to help you with rotation!
Standing Back Tuck Tutorial
BACK TUCK MISTAKES THAT PREVENT YOU FROM LANDING | 6 tips improve height and form in a standing bt
How To Back Tuck | Tumbling Tutorial

name: Roundoff Back Handspring Back Tuck
description: A connected tumbling sequence finishing with a back tuck, combining speed and height from the preceding skills to complete the flip.
shapeTip: Use momentum from the BHS, drive arms up into a tight tuck. Rotate quickly and prepare for a soft, centered landing.

movements.name: Roundoff Rebounds
movements.instructions: Perform roundoffs with a strong snap-down and rebound to build explosive connection prep.

movements.name: Back Handspring to Rebound
movements.instructions: Perform a back handspring with an aggressive snap-down, focusing on height and timing of the rebound.

movements.name: Tuck Jumps with Arm Swing
movements.instructions: Practice standing tuck jumps using a powerful arm swing, aiming for tight knees and chest position.

movements.name: RO-BHS-Back Tuck Attempts
movements.instructions: Connect a roundoff, back handspring, and back tuck. Focus on power, tight rotation, and soft landings.

movements.name: Rest
movements.instructions: Relax, breathe deeply, and shake out your legs and arms. Recover before the next round.

tutorials.title: Round Off Back-handspring Tuck drills
Back Tuck Drill
The Recipes: Running Tuck Breakdown

name: Roundoff Back Handspring Layout
description: This combination pass uses a roundoff and back handspring to generate power for a layout flip, maintaining a straight body line throughout the rotation.
shapeTip: Set vertically from the handspring, keeping arms tight. Hold a hollow position throughout the layout and maintain full body control until landing.

movements.name: Roundoff Rebounds
movements.instructions: Perform roundoffs with strong snap-downs and high rebounds to generate power for layout.

movements.name: Hollow Body Holds
movements.instructions: Lie on your back with arms by ears and hold a tight hollow position to build body tension needed for layouts.

movements.name: Back Handspring to Rebound
movements.instructions: Focus on snapping down out of the back handspring and rebounding tall with arms tight to simulate layout prep.

movements.name: RO-BHS-Layout Attempts
movements.instructions: Connect roundoff and back handspring into a stretched layout. Emphasize hollow shape and controlled rotation.

movements.name: Rest
movements.instructions: Shake out your legs and arms. Take a deep breath and reset for the next round.

tutorials.title: The Recipes: Running Layout Breakdown
Layout drills
If you lack technique you lose the freedom to create. Layout Drills.
Fun Layout Drill for Tumblers

name: Roundoff Back Handspring Full
description: This tumbling pass begins with a roundoff and back handspring to build momentum, finishing with a layout that includes a full 360-degree twist. It requires strong technique and spatial awareness to execute safely and cleanly.
shapeTip: Push through the roundoff and snap down in the back handspring to generate power. Set tall from the handspring, initiate the twist using shoulder and hip drive, and maintain a tight, extended body line through the full rotation.

movements.name: Layout Rebounds
movements.instructions: Connect roundoff and back handspring into a layout. Focus on strong set, hollow body position, and height.

movements.name: Twisting Prep Drills
movements.instructions: Practice jump half and full turns with arms tight and eyes spotting. Build twist awareness and control.

movements.name: Layout Half Twists
movements.instructions: Perform layouts with a controlled half twist to introduce twisting mechanics while maintaining body tension.

movements.name: RO-BHS-Full Attempts
movements.instructions: Perform roundoff-back handspring fulls, emphasizing height, a clean twist, and a tight landing position.

movements.name: Rest
movements.instructions: Breathe and shake out. Use this time to mentally reset and review your technique.

tutorials.title: BEGINNING TWISTING // Tumbling Drills
Beginner Full Twist Drills
3 Progressions For The Back Full Twisting Layout | Tumbling Tutorial
Full Twisting Layout Drill

name: Standing Back Full
description: A standing layout with a full twist, performed without a roundoff or handspring. It showcases strength, control, and explosive vertical lift.
shapeTip: Jump powerfully upward and reach full extension before beginning the twist. Keep the twist tight and spot the landing early.

movements.name: Standing Layout Drills
movements.instructions: Practice straight body jumps with hollow shape, focusing on tight form and vertical set.

movements.name: Twist Awareness Jumps
movements.instructions: Perform jump half and full turns with arms tight and core engaged to develop air sense.

movements.name: Block and Turn Drill
movements.instructions: Jump up with a strong block, then initiate a quick twist with shoulder and hip coordination.

movements.name: Standing Full Attempts
movements.instructions: Perform standing fulls focusing on height, tight twist mechanics, and clean landings.

movements.name: Rest
movements.instructions: Recover with deep breathing and shake out legs. Mentally prep for the next set.

tutorials.title: Standing Fulls Drills.
Drills for the standing full
STANDING FULL DRILLS!

name: Roundoff Back Handspring Double Full
description: A high-level tumbling pass that links a roundoff and back handspring into a double full twist, maximizing momentum and airtime.
shapeTip: Snap the BHS tight, set tall, and immediately initiate two fast twists. Stay hollow and controlled through the spin, landing cleanly.

movements.name: Full Twist Layout Drills
movements.instructions: Perform layouts with a full twist, focusing on height, body control, and clean rotation mechanics.

movements.name: Snap-Down and Set Conditioning
movements.instructions: Practice snapping down out of the back handspring into a vertical set with tight arms and hollow shape.

movements.name: Twist Acceleration Drills
movements.instructions: Work jump full to double full progressions with rapid shoulder and hip rotation while maintaining control.

movements.name: RO-BHS-Double Full Attempts
movements.instructions: Connect roundoff and back handspring into a double full twist. Emphasize height, fast twist, and a tight landing.

movements.name: Rest
movements.instructions: Take time to recover. Focus on breathing and resetting your mind and body before the next rep.
